name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with spices. Stuff into dough made of wheat flour, salt and oil then and roll. Cook on tawa with oil.

name: Onion Pakora
instructions: Slice onions, mix with besan and spices. Deep fry till golden.

name: Fruit Salad
instructions: Chop fruits and mix with chilled milk and sugar.

name: Idli and Chutney
instructions: Mix the idli flour, water, and sour curd well.
Add salt to the batter once it has risen, and mix
After greasing the idli stand with oil, ladle the batter into the idli molds.
Add 1/2 cup of water to the stand; bring to a boil. Close the cover after inserting the idli stand. Before turning off the gas, wait for 8 to 10 minutes for the steam to accumulate.
In a blender add 3/4 cup of grated coconut, a small piece of ginger and 1 or 2 green chilli then blend. Now you have your chutney.
Take the idilies off the steamer

name: Chapati and Dal Curry
instructions: soak the dal in water for a few minutes.
Mix wheat flour with salt, a teaspoon of oil and water then knead. Make small balls of the dough, flatten them and cook on tawa flipping them halfway through.
Now that you have made the chapatis, chop up the onions, green chilli and coriander leaves and heat them on a pan with a tablespoon of oil.
Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and some water. add the soaked, strained dals and mix until most of the water has evaporated.
Enjoy

name: Puttum Kadalayum
instructions: Soak the dry kadala in water for 3 or 4 hours
Mix grated coconut with rice powder, salt and water then pour into the puttu steaming vessel and steam it for 8 mins. Now, you have puttu.
For the kadala curry, add the chopped onions, tomatos and saute them with oil. Then add in the chilli and turmeric powders
Add in the soaked and strained chana, add water and stir until a lot of the water has boiled off.
Enjoy

name: Upma and Vegetable Korma
instructions: Roast the rava on a pan with ghee.
On another pan, heat oil and put some mustard seeds, onion, curry leaves and carrot and stir. Afterwards add some water and some salt. wait til boil.
pour the roasted rava in and mix thoughly to avoid lumps. The upma is complete.
For the korma cut all the vegetables into small pieces put them in a pan in a pressure cooker with water and cook them.
In a mixer add coconut shavings, 4 green chilies, small piece of ginger and 3 cloves of garlic with garam masala and salt and blend them.
Add the blended ingredients into the cooker and cook them for some minutes.
In a pan, add oil, curry leaves and mustard seeds and boil tem with the korma. Enjoy

name: Rice and Rajma
instructions: Boil the rice grains with water and salt.
Soak the rajma for approx. 6 hours.
Afterwards, cook the rajma in the pressure cooker with salt and water and some chopped onions and green chilli.

In the pan heat the oil then add chopped onions, tomato, chilli powder, turmuric power, coriander powder and saute. Add the contents of the pressure cooker and cook them until the water has reduced greatly. Enjoy.

name: Chole Bhature
instructions: make the dough using maida, rava, ghee, sugar, salt, a pinch of baking soda and curd with water. Flatten the dough balls and fry them to get the bhature
The chickpeas have to be soaked in water for 6 to 7 hours before being cooked inside a pressure cooker with some salt. Drain the water and keep aside.
In a blender blend together tomatoes, onoins, ginger, garlic, and chilli
On a pan add all the spices and roast them for a minute.
Add the blended paste, saute for a few more minutes and add the dry spice powders with one green chilli
Add the chana then continue sitirring for a few minutes.
Enjoy

name: Kichidi
instructions: Soak rice and moong dal and set aside
In a pressure cooker heat ghee the add cumin, a pinch of hing, a piece of ginger, chopped onions, one green chilli and stir without burning.
Then add chopped tomato, turmuric powder, salt and the other vegetables
Add the dal now and let it fry, then add the strained rice with some water
Close the lid of the pressure cooker for some time. after wards the kichidi is ready.

name: Chapati and Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Make dough from wheat flour and water. Roll into chapatis and cook on tawa.
For paneer masala, blend tomatoes into a puree, cook with butter and spices.
Add cream and paneer cubes. Simmer and serve with chapatis.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Sauté spices in ghee, add sliced onions and vegetables.
Add rice and water. Cook until rice is fluffy and vegetables are soft.

name: Rasam and Rice
instructions: Boil tamarind water with tomato, garlic, pepper, cumin and salt.
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves, pour into rasam.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Make dosa batter from soaked rice and urad dal.
Prepare potato filling with mustard seeds, curry leaves, onion and turmeric.
Pour batter on tawa, add filling, fold and serve.

name: Vegetable Sandwich
instructions: Spread butter and chutney on bread slices.
Layer sliced vegetables with salt and pepper.
Close sandwich and optionally grill or toast.

name: French Toast
instructions: Whisk egg, milk, sugar and cinnamon.
Dip bread slices and cook on pan with butter until golden.
Serve hot.

name: Macaroni Masala
instructions: Boil macaroni and keep aside.
Sauté onion and tomato in oil with spices.
Add macaroni, mix well, and serve hot.
